comment.author: 68439219@N06
comment._content:
Photos September 1912  builders  Allen Canton (35) and John J. Meckler (23)  
 Bronx, New York
Transatlantic aircraft    "hydroaeroplane"  location: Clason Point, New York
Plan was to fly across Atlantic Ocean in three days 104 feet in length  70 feet  (76) wingtip to wingtip  wing area 2,000 ( 2400) square feet  
( Washington Post Oct. 20,1912 )

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks to both of you for this information. We'll add some of it to the record the next time we update.
